admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Xiamen Port Project in China. The
            project's main objectives were to improve operations
            and maintenance at the port, increase its capacity to handle
            cargo flow, and help preserve the environment. The project
            was completed satisfactorily by March 31, 1995. Despite the
            one-year delay, project implementation was satisfactory
            because all objectives were achieved. At completion, the
            project appeared sustainable. The findings and lessons
            include the following: (a) Xiamen Port Bureau (XPB) capably
            implemented the construction and procurement of equipment,
            carried out studies and developed its organization; (b) The
            flexible project designs included in the project for
            converting the wharves were essential; they allowed
            authorities to respond rapidly to changing demand; (c) When
            Borrowers are unfamiliar with Bank procedures, delays--as
            occurred with procurement under this project -- are
            unavoidable. For this reason, the Bank's project
            workshops are helpful; (d) Performance indicators with
            regard to port operations, maintenance and environmental
            quality were clearly stated in the Staff Appraisal Report
            (SAR) and proved quite useful; (e) Project design was
            relatively straightforward, which averted the problems with
            coordination among various agencies; and (f) Courses offered
            outside the country for managers should be tailored
            specifically for the staff being sent.
